title: Nice
review: This temple was made by the person who had made the temple of Hanumangarh in Nainital. Many believers and worshipers tie bells around the temple for god to fulfill their wishes

title: Another temple
review: While the place has a lot of reverence by locals, for the tourist, its just another point. If one is not too religious, can easily skip it.

title: Peaceful Place
review: Ranikhet is one of the most beautiful places i have been. and Jhula Devi Temple is One of the main Attraction here.

title: Blessed to visit
review: Very ancient and beautiful temple...The temple is very nice and spacious. There were many many bells hanging there... Perfect place to meditate and relax your soul.

title: Wonderful Experience
review: We arrived right before closing so were very few people which made it very special. Lots of folks in the day.  You could feel your wishes going right to the heavens when you rang the bells

title: A fascinating sight for sure with countless bells tied on different areas of the temple
review: Dedicated to the goddess Jhula Devi, Jhula Devi temple was a fascinating sight for sure with countless bells tied on different areas of the temple. As per the saying, you have to tie a bell in the temple and make a wish. We also tied the bell purchased from the shop outside and made a wish!

title: Avoidable for non-religious tourists
review: Nothing here for people except those who have some religious reasons tobe here.

title: Small temple in the forest of Ranikhet
review: Located near the army establishment, this temple has an interesting folklore about why the deity is on a "jhula".

title: Nice place in ranikhet
review: This one has some history and temple has bells all over. Neat and clean and nice experience. Definitely should visit if in ranikhet.

title: Ranikhet Jhula Devi temple is beautiful. Legend says the Goddess wanted a swing for herself after seeing loving children
review: This beautiful temple is at Ranikhet, a distance of about 2 hours from Almora. The legend says that locals when faced with threats from wild beasts worshipped the Goddess who revealed herself in the form of a statue and a temple was made for her. The threat from the beasts disappeared. Later on the Goddess, on seeing children merrymaking on swings revealed herself again and wanted a similar swing for herself. The villagers mounted her on a swing and hence her name Jhula Devi. It is a beautiful temple where thousands and thousands of bells hang in gratitude for wishes fulfilled by the grace of the Goddess.

title: Visit if you are in ranikhet
review: The road to jhula Devi temple is through the army cantonment area. It's lined with bells and gives you a peaceful feeling.

title: Very Old Goddess Durga Temple
review: If visiting in and around Ranikhet, it is worth visiting this temple. Temple believed to be over 700 years old.

title: temple with several bells
review: This temple is on the way to Ranikhet from Nainital. it has several bells tied all around the temple. it is close to Military area.

title: Small temple at RaniKhet
review: One can stop by when at Ranikhet. Since the temple is small, there is nothing much to spend lot of time. It is on the way to Chaubatia Gardens.

title: Nice Goddess Temple
review: The belief is that the goddess here came to rescue of villagers from wild animals, and some one promised to place her on a swing, thats how it gets the jhula devi temple

title: Old temple
review: this is old temple in between ranikhet to chaubatiya garden at cantonment area..peacefull environment

title: A Durga Mata temple
review: A good temple where people ask Godess Durga to fulfill their wishes. It is a historic temple. Mata Durga is on Jhula and worshiped by locals to escape themselves and cattles from lions, leopards

title: ranikhet
review: A person who stays in almora must visit ranikhet as well..... its only 40 kms away and a beautiful place. J hula devi temple is a place where you can pray for something in your heart and whenever you get that thing in your life then you have to go back to temple and tie a ghantee there.

title: Bells bells all around
review: Its on the way back from chaubatia garden to the main town. Can be seen if you have enough time. Bells here are the main attraction which are tied here by the wish makers

title: Nice road...temple with a story to narrate...lots of bells
review: Situated in Ranikhet. The Ranikhet area is mainly occupied by Army. The temple is accessible by road. No climbing of steps and hence elders may comfortably go there. Have your food before reaching there in case you are planning to have food there. There is hardly one small hotel wherein you can enjoy maggie and tea. In many of the temples in this part of Uttarakhand I observed that tying the Bell is common tradition. Probably as a part of wish or in gratitude for completing the wish. Here too you can find thousands of bells of different sizes all along the pillars of the temple. The road is good and road to Jhula devi temple is surrounded by Pine trees.

title: Nice temple
review: Nice and calm place, also it is a hill top, so you get panaromic view of Himalaya. It's just walking distance from hotel, so do visit in case you decide to go and stay at this hotel.

title: Goddess Durga
review: The temple 40 Kms far from Almora near Ranikhet.The temple is known for Goddess Juhla Devi, the god of healing power & protector of animals & beast. In the old days there are lots of animals who carry away the pet animals & men.Then local village people worship the Goddess to protect them.Now it is very popular to every tourist who visit here.

title: Write a Petition it works
review: Travelers with a special request or boon leave their petitions here in writing. When it is granted they return to install a bell - from the number of bells it must work. So get busy and write that petition now.
